Articles.Content: What is you favorite planet or moon? It can be for any reason at all! (failed mission there etc)
For me, it has to be Duna. Its redness draws me in like a moth to a flame. I always like to explore its barren yet warm and comfortable surface. And If I am lucky, Ill get Ike in the horizon
Minmus, it is like landing on a cloud.

Eve, beautiful and equally deadly. Also the immense challenge of landing and leaving again from sea level gives me something to aspire toward, like a final goal until they add some more planets/moons which also feels almost completely unachievable.

Gilly, since there is such low gravity.

Same goes for Minmus, Bop, Pol, and Ike.
Quite a few more answers in this thread which pretty much asked the same question.
My current project is to build a spaceplane that can land there and return to orbit. Which is pretty hard considering I suck at making planes.

Mine is this planet.

(I cant remember the name)

I like Eve, it's more than just a Venus like planet. The purple colour and oceans give it a true alien feel.

One day I May send a manned (Kerballed) flight there but at this point it's beyond my scope, one day I will tho...
I like Jool. I don't know why, I just like going there. Something about glowing green planet that makes me like it.
I spend most of my time at minmus. It is easy to get to and land on.
What... what in the world is the blue gas giant?
I really wish Jool looked more like Jupiter, with swirling cloud patterns and whatnot. Either that or they should add thin rings to make it resemble Uranus and Neptune.
I'm a big fan of Mun, plenty of craters to go exploring in, some fun poles and many Easter eggs

Mine is this planet.

(I cant remember the name)

Wow thats a nice concept planet you made there! Now I wish it really was in the game...

I love Minmus. It's easy to get there and the landing conditions are excellent.

My most favorite planet is Jool... I have no idea why, I just like to go there. I'm currently planning to build a space station there, but things aren't going very well... yet.
Its a mod I snagged before the thread got locked. Ill post more pics tommorow of my fav moon.

Laythe. That was the first body I ever landed on in KSP that just had me in awe when I got there the first time. Everything about getting there in back is just too much fun, not to mention challenging. Building a suitable ship in Kerbin orbit, getting it out to Jool, aerocapture, then there's Laythe's tiny SOI. The large oceans make targeting a landing site that much more challenging, while the atmosphere makes getting back to orbit very interesting.

Now that the Mun has a facelift though, I've got to say its more fun roving around there than anywhere else, and the career mode biomes really give you a great excuse to go on a tour.
Laythe. (shouldn't all planet and moon names be 10 char. so I don't have to type this?)
